skill.name: mermaid-flowchart
skill.description: Flowcharts are composed of **nodes** (geometric shapes) and **edges** (arrows or lines). The Mermaid code defines how nodes and edges are made and accommodates different arrow types, multi-directional arrows, and any linking to and from subgraphs.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference material for Mermaid flowchart syntax. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access.

content.value_statement: Creating flowcharts manually takes time and requires graphical tools. This skill provides instant access to Mermaid flowchart syntax, allowing you to generate professional diagrams directly from text descriptions.
actual_capabilities: Generate flowcharts using Mermaid syntax from text descriptions
Create nodes with various shapes (rectangle, diamond, circle, cylinder, etc.)
Add edges with arrows, dotted lines, and text labels
Apply styling with colors, borders, and custom CSS classes
Build complex diagrams with subgraphs and multi-directional arrows
Add interactive click events and hyperlinks to flowchart nodes
limitations: Does not render diagrams directly; generates Mermaid syntax that must be rendered by a Mermaid viewer
Does not validate flowchart logic or detect circular dependencies
Does not support animated diagrams beyond basic edge animations
Does not provide visual drag-and-drop flowchart editing

best_practices: Keep node IDs short and meaningful for easier diagram maintenance
Use consistent direction (LR for left-to-right, TD for top-to-bottom) throughout the flowchart
Add comments in the diagram code to explain complex sections for future reference
anti_patterns: Using lowercase 'end' as node text without modification (breaks Mermaid parsing)
Placing spaces between node text and connecting characters
Creating overly complex single-line declarations that reduce readability

faq.question: Which tools support Mermaid flowchart syntax?
faq.answer: Mermaid is supported by GitHub, GitLab, Notion, Obsidian, VS Code, Confluence, and many documentation platforms.

faq.question: What is the maximum flowchart complexity supported?
faq.answer: Complexity limits depend on the rendering tool. Most viewers handle hundreds of nodes. Use the ELK renderer for large diagrams.

faq.question: Can I use Mermaid in my documentation?
faq.answer: Yes. Add mermaid diagrams in markdown files. GitHub renders them automatically in issues, PRs, and markdown files.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only generates text syntax. No data is sent anywhere. Rendering happens locally in your viewing application.

faq.question: Why is my flowchart not rendering correctly?
faq.answer: Check for reserved words like 'end' in node text. Avoid spaces between nodes and arrows. Use proper escaping for special characters.

faq.question: How does this compare to graphical flowchart tools?
faq.answer: Mermaid offers faster creation via text, version control friendly code, and consistent rendering. Graphical tools provide drag-and-drop editing.
